{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3557710,"name":"Ryan K.","username":"6865ProgrammerRyan","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/6/bcef8e/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-15T17:15:00.387Z","cooked":"

Hi, Programmer here, looking for help with our swerve odometry w/ Limelight and Pathplanner. Our robot is behaving weirdly, with red and blue driverstation behaviors being flipped (Red fwd to positive X, Blue fwd to negative x, same issue with Y). I’ve already tried flipping the kZero and k180degrees for the operator perspective, which does fix tele-op behevior, but messes up our visioning to a ridiculous degree - when they are flipped, visioning shows correct for blue, but very off values (like x:3, y:10) for red (placing robot by driverstation in front of apriltags 19 and 6, tags on angled panels torwards matching barge).

We used CTRE swerve generator to set up swerve, and have one limelight giving megatags 2 feedback (making me think it’s a gyro/heading issue of some sort, or something with operator perspectives clashing with heading).

Code is located here:
6865 Robot Code

Any Ideas on what’s the problem and how to fix it?
